comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: The big question is do our financial system support cryptocurrency transactions? The answer is NO because the CBN has placed a ban on any financial institutions from offering cryptocurrency transactions and that is a big setback for exchanges that looking for ways to further improve their payment system by incorporating NGN vs USDT but then the law has the oversight right to place and restriction and kucoin as an exchange wanting to operate a Nigeria subsidiary will still face the same policy restrictions that can delay their development. So the best possible means of making any NGN VS USDT on the exchange still remains the P2P method so nothing has changed but all together this is a good attempt from Kucoin.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Hyphen(-) on July 27, 2023, 11:14:11 AMObservationbut why require additional information apart from card details? Security is the reason.This international online payment gateway that allows the use of our local card information requests those details in order to verify if the person trying to make a purchase with the card is the rightful owner, as the billing address that you are to fill in must be the same as what's registered with the account that issued that card. That information alone on some sites can authorize the payment without even waiting for some authorization from your bank; no OTP or even card pin might be needed. They are security measures that almost every site applies to card payments.
